result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Completion of Representation filed by Atty. Justin Griffis
Motion to forfeit bail granted. Motion to forfeit bail granted.

Body Only
Bail Jumping from Milwaukee County Case 20CM1948

Case called at 9:41 AM 
Charles Patrick Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Justin G Griffis in court.   Defendant Claudio Jose Garcia did not appear.   
State requests that a Capias be issued and bail be revoked and forfeited.
Court will issue a Capias.
Bail is to be revoked and forfeited.
Hearing on July 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:06 AM   File not called on the record.
Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Claudio Jose Garcia in court with attorney Justin Griffis. 
Attorney Griffis requests another hearing date.  Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on May 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.

01:19 PM Defendant Claudio Jose Garcia in court with attorney Justin G Griffis.  Attorney appears as friend of the court.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Griffis states the defendant does need to do another e-form with their office but believes the defendant will qualify for their representation.  The Court will set this matter before the Trial Court.  Hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

Hearing on March 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Claudio Jose Garcia
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 03-16-2022)
Prior: 702 Scott Ave, Waukesha, WI 53186

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any, CBD products, vaping products, controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.  Defendant to have no contact with victim A/individuals listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

02:41 PM Defendant Claudio Jose Garcia in court, in custody, with State Public Defender Law Intern, as a friend of the court.   Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for March 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
